messages.message:
Hello everyone,
has anyone experience with cloudwatch? I am preparing a script that will log some benchmark data to cloudwatch and according to my code foo skills (guh chat gpt guh)  I need to have some access keys
```aws_access_key_id,
aws_secret_access_key```
does anyone know how can I obtain them? Also how they can rename active for “ever” (I will run the script from a dedicated ec2 machine)

I think this is something SRE and IT team should help you with
IT will help granting the access and SRE will help figure out best practices with your use case
is it urgent? if not we can wait till Aaron comes back from PTO

hi @Nikolaos Kofinas
what’s the use case for sending log data to cloudwatch?
FYI we also have central observability datastore for logs. can we explore options to send this log data there?

so the idea is to keep track of how the model behave over time to catch regressions (either if we change a model or if openai does something wanky), I am open to other ideas as well, cloudwatch was just the most straight forward to implement (easy to create and visualize graphs)

Got it. This use case can be catered by central observability setup.
We use Loki for log storage &  central grafana (https://grafana.console.instabase.com/login) for visualisation where we can create dashboard and graphs.
plus we have alerting support as well.

feel free to schedule a call and we can discuss further.
please include @HH as well.
